intro: Cyanea elliptica, commonly known as the Hawaiian violet, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. Cyanea elliptica is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a keystone species in certain habitats.
